Varying APD rates are dictated by the classification of worldwide destinations by the UK government, with passengers taking trips to the Caribbean being particularly badly hit. the unusual things teams are coming up with to defend Michael Vick . "I think we're making good adjustments as players and coaches; I like to do that sooner than later," Reid said. We're getting some unique looks. Everybody has a certain way,[ defensively] that they're playing Michael Vick , and it's not your normal- it's hard to put on another tape and see teams do what they do to Michael Vick , they just change things up and throw you a little bit of a curveball. So you have to make some adjustments. You have to be able to do that. Sunday, the biggest adjustment seemed to be the offensive line finally sorting out the Giants' blitzes, giving Michael Vick a little time and room to work with, especially when he decided to run.

and tactics of Egypt's security state No, they weren't talking about Hosni Mubarak , the Egyptian dictator chased from power last Friday. On the president, opinions were mixed. But the answer to the question what would you most like to see changed about the regime could be boiled down to two words: Zahi Hawass . of Defense Victoria Clarke later said. Al Jazeera reporter Tareq Ayyoub was killed when US bombs hit the network's Baghdad offices in 2003. "This coalition does not target journalists," Brigadier Gen. David Petraeus Vincent K. Brooks insisted. We don't know every place journalists are operating on the battlefield. It's a dangerous place, indeed. A furious Donald Rumsfeld blasted the network's 2004 coverage of civilian casualties in Fallujah as "vicious, inaccurate and inexcusable."
